com.sadakatsu.clue.ai
Class SpeedClueAI

java.lang.Object
  com.sadakatsu.clue.ai.SpeedClueAI
Direct Known Subclasses:
RandomAI
public abstract class SpeedClueAI
extends java.lang.Object

SpeedClueAI is an abstract superclass for Java Speed Clue players. It encapsulates the behavior necessary for interfacing with the server and provides abstract methods for making the actual decisions.

Author:
Joseph A. Craig

logMessages

protected final boolean logMessages
Constructor Detail

SpeedClueAI

public SpeedClueAI(java.lang.String identifier,
                   int serverPort,
                   boolean logMessages)
            throws java.io.IOException
Instantiates a new SpeedClueAI instance with a connection to the server.

Parameters:
identifier - The name given to this player by the server.
serverPort - The localhost port number for the server.
logMessages - Whether to write messages received by and sent from this player to stdout.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

inGame

public boolean inGame()
Whether this player is currently in a game. This does not represent whether the player has not yet already lost.

Returns:
true if the player is playing a game, false otherwise.

getIndex

public int getIndex()
This player's position in the current game's player order.

Returns:
A number in the range [0..playerCount) if the player is currently in a game, or -1 if it is not.

getPlayerCount

public int getPlayerCount()
The number of players in the current game.

Returns:
A number in the range [3..6] if the player is currently in a game, or -1 otherwise.

getPlayersInGame

public int getPlayersInGame()
The number of players that can still play. Players that have made incorrect accusations have lost and will not be counted.

Returns:
The number of players still playing, or -1 if the player is not in a game.

getHand

public java.util.List<Card> getHand()
This player's current hand for the current game.

Returns:
A List of the Cards dealt to this player if the player is in a game. If the List is empty, then the player is currently not in a game.

getPastSuggestions

public java.util.List<Suggestion> getPastSuggestions()
All the Suggestions the player has made this game.

Returns:
A List of all the Suggestions the player has made this game. The List can be empty if the player is not in a game or has yet to make any Suggestions.

getIdentifier

public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
The player's name.

Returns:
The String passed to the constructor by the server.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String to identify this Player in output.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

run

public void run()
         throws java.io.IOException,
                InvalidDisprove,
                DuplicateSuggestion
Makes the player communicate with the server until the server tells it to stop. Regardless of how this method exits, the instance's connection to the server is closed.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
InvalidDisprove
DuplicateSuggestion

getDisproveCards

protected java.util.List<Card> getDisproveCards(java.util.List<Card> hand,
                                                Suggestion suggestion)
Returns the Cards in the passed Hand that can be used to disprove the passed Suggestion.

Parameters:
hand - The hand that must be used to disprove the Suggestion.
suggestion - The Suggestion to disprove.
Returns:
A list of Cards that can be used to Disprove the passed Suggestion.

getMyDisproveCards

protected java.util.List<Card> getMyDisproveCards(Suggestion suggestion)
Returns the Cards in this player's hand that can be used to disprove the passed Suggestion.

Parameters:
suggestion - The Suggestion to disprove.
Returns:
A list of Cards that can be used to Disprove the passed Suggestion.

getHandSize

protected int getHandSize(int numberOfPlayers,
                          int playerIndex)
Returns the number of Cards a given player should have.

Parameters:
numberOfPlayers - The number of players playing a game.
playerIndex - The index of the given player in the play order.
Returns:
The number of Cards the given player should have in his hand.

accuse

protected abstract Suggestion accuse()
Chooses either an accusation to make or not to make an accusation.

Returns:
A Suggestion object that represents the accusation if the player chose to make an accusation or null if the player chose not to make an accusation.

disprove

protected abstract Card disprove(int suggester,
                                 Suggestion suggestion)
Chooses a Card in the intersection between this player's hand and the Suggestion's Cards to return to disprove the Suggestion to the suggester.

Parameters:
suggester - The index of the player who made the Suggestion.
suggestion - The Suggestion that this player can and must disprove.
Returns:
The Card that the player chose to disprove the Suggestion.

suggest

protected abstract Suggestion suggest()
Chooses a Suggestion to make that this player has not yet made.

Returns:
The Suggestion that this player chose.

prepareForGame

protected abstract void prepareForGame()
Performs any work that is necessary for the player to be ready to play a new game.

stopPlaying

protected abstract void stopPlaying()
Performs any work that is necessary for the player to stop playing before informing the server that it has indeed stopped playing.

processAccusation

protected abstract void processAccusation(int accuser,
                                          Suggestion accusation,
                                          boolean correct)
Performs any player-specific processing related to the passed accusation. If the accusation ends the game (inGame() == false), this method also cleans up any subclass game-specific instance data.

Parameters:
accuser - The index of the player who made the accusation.
accusation - The accusation the player made.
correct - Whether the accusation matches the solution (true) or not (false).

processSuggestion

protected abstract void processSuggestion(int suggester,
                                          Suggestion suggestion,
                                          java.lang.Integer disprover,
                                          Card shown)
Performs any player-specific processing related to the passed Suggestion.

Parameters:
suggester - The index of the player who made the Suggestion.
suggestion - The Suggestion that was made.
disprover - The index of the player that disproved the Suggestion, or null if the Suggestion was not disproved.
shown - If either this player is neither the suggester nor the disprover, or the Suggestion was not disproved, this argument is null. Otherwise, this argument holds the Card that was shown.
